revised_title: Thermal Properties of Alkali Halide Crystals: Heat Capacity of Potassium Salts and Sodium Iodide
tldr: The authors measured the heat capacity of potassium chloride, potassium bromide, potassium iodide, and sodium iodide between 2.8 and 270 K using adiabatic calorimeter assemblies. The results show that the heat capacity of these alkali halide crystals generally agrees with the predictions of harmonic lattice theory, except at the highest temperatures. This study provides a foundation for further analysis and interpretation of the thermal properties of these crystals.
